title: Kimchi-Marinated Broccoli Rabe
ingredients: - 1 pound broccoli rabe, woody bottoms trimmed, cut into 2-inch pieces
- 1 tablespoon Korean rice syrup, maple syrup, or agave syrup
directions: 1. Rinse the broccoli rabe briefly under cold water and shake off most of the water, leaving a little clinging to help it steam during cooking.
2. Combine the olive oil and garlic in a large skillet and set over high heat.
3. When the garlic turns light golden brown, add the broccoli rabe and cook, stirring occasionally, until just tender but still crisp, about 30 to 45 seconds.
4. Season with salt and cook for 15 seconds more.
5. Transfer the broccoli rabe and garlic to a medium mixing bowl, leaving behind any liquid in the skillet. Let cool slightly, then pour off any liquid that pools in the bowl.
6. Add the gochugaru, soy sauce, rice syrup, sesame oil, sesame seeds, and finely grated zest and juice of the lemon to the bowl.
8. Serve warm, or store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week.
